member.name: T:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.CellEventArgs
member.summary: CellEventArgs are the arguments for a Cell Click (or double click) event. The information includes RowNumber, ColumnNumber and CellType.
member.remarks: It effectively encapsulates the information from a HitTest.

summary.p: Customised HBOS FS AMP Data Grid.
Extends the native DataGrid functionality by providing Write (Extract to file), Print and Print Preview functionality.

remarks.p: Methods added to the grid include
Events added to the grid include:
Note: If you add a tablestyle to the grid, it will overwrite the default styling of the grid. If you wish to reapply the default datagrid style, call the method.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.Write(System.Data.DataView,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Write/Extract the contents of the grid into a file using an embedded XSL.
member.param: The DataView to write to the file.
The filename to write the grid contents to.
The embedded Xsl resource to use when writing the grid contents to file.

remarks.para: An XSLT is used to format the output of the DataView when writing to the file.
remarks.note: The top level node will be called "DataGrid".
Each row will be tagged with the original TableName from the DataView.
The xslt must be an embedded resource.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.Write(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Write/Extract the contents of the grid into a file using an embedded XSL.
member.param: The filename to write the grid contents to.
The embedded Xsl resource to use when writing the grid contents to file.

remarks.para: An XSLT is used to format the output of the DataView when writing to the file.
remarks.note: The top level node will be called "DataGrid".
Each row will be tagged with the original TableName from the DataView.
The xslt must be an embedded resource.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.DataGrid_Enter(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When the grid becomes the active control, make sure it has the focus
member.remarks: This is a really nasty hack. It looks like when the DataGrid becomes the active control, focus is set to the first column in the grid. If this is a ComboBox column, it causes a runtime exception. By setting the focus to the grid, the problem seems to go away.

member.name: T:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.DataGridImageColumn
member.summary: DataGridImageColumn - allow images to be displayed in Data Grid Column

remarks.p: It assumes the underlying data is an enum. The images displayed are stored in the ImageList and the image displayed is the associated position in the ImageList
Both the test associated with the enum and the icon itself are displayed.

member.summary: Retrieve the display text

member.name: T:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.EnumComboBox
member.summary: A combo box that displays the contents of an enum whose items are decorated with the EnumDisplayTextAttribute attribute.

example.para: The enum must be attributed with the appropriate information.
example.code: public enum MyColours : int { [EnumDisplayText("Blaze Red")] Red, [EnumDisplayText("Shocking Blue")] Blue, [EnumDisplayText("Grass Green")] Green, [EnumDisplayText("Storm Purple")] Purple }
example.para: The enum type is then assigned to the Enum combo

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.EnumComboBox.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new EnumComboBox

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.EnumComboBox.SelectedItem
member.summary: Returns the selected enum value

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.EnumComboBox.Enum
member.summary: Set the enum that will be displayed in the combo box

summary.p: The namespace provides generic AMP Window Controls. These include:

list.item: - an enhanced datagrid allowing printing, exporting, and custom column types.
- a textbox which only allows numeric text entry, and has a Max and Min value.
- a combo that can be populated with an enum with the appropriate attributes.

summary.p:
The datagrid also includes extended Designer Support. This also the user to choose the new custom column styles through the GUI designer.
- custimised column styles collection editor.
- custimised table style editor.
- custimised table styles collection editor.

The custom column types currently supported by the Grid include
- a column with a combo box
- a column with an image.
- a normal column but it can't receive the focus.
summary.para: is dependent upon HBOS.FS.AMP.Utilities. The DataGrid uses for access to embedded resource for its write functionality.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NamespaceDoc.#ctor
member.summary: This class is a dummy class used by NDoc to provide a namespace summary.

member.name: T:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox
member.summary: A text box that only allows the entry of numbers.
member.remarks: Useful for currency fields etc where we want to prevent the use from entering alphabetic characters.

example.para: A number of properties on the control should be set to ensure the user is limited to entering correct data.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.setToolTip
member.summary: Set the tooltip for the control.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.setMaskExpression
member.summary: Set the mask regular expression for the control. This is based on the number for decimal places and the minimum and maximum expression.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.validString(System.String)
member.summary: Validate whether a given string is a valid number for this control.

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.validCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Validate the entry of a new character.
member.param: The character that the user wants to add to the control
member.returns: true if valid, false if not

member.name: M:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.isNumeric(System.String)
member.summary: Tests whether a string is numeric.
member.returns: true if numeric, false if not

member.summary: Construct a new numeric text box

member.summary: A key has been pressed so check it's validity.

member.summary: The control is losing focus so remove any garbage left behind.

member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: The number of digits to the right of the decimal point.

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.MinValue
member.summary: The minimum value the control will accept

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.MaxValue
member.summary: The maximum value the control will accept

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Indicates whether the control shows tool tips.

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.Text
member.summary: The text displayed in the control

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.Value
member.summary: The decimal value of the text displayed - can be different from the Text value if the TextMultiplier is not 1.

member.name: P:HBOS.FS.AMP.Windows.Controls.NumericTextBox.ValueMultiplier
member.summary:
The value multiplier.
Values set/get via the Value property have the multiplier applied to them. i.e. for a multiplier of 100:
12 passed in to the Value property would result in "1200" being displayed If "6.0000" was displayed, this value accessed via the Value property would return 0.06
